title: Mexico Interest Rate
description: The benchmark interest rate in Mexico was last recorded at 10 percent. Interest Rate in Mexico averaged 5.75 percent from 2005 until 2022, reaching an all time high of 10 percent in November of 2022 and a record low of 3 percent in June of 2014. In Mexico, interest rate decisions are taken by the Bank of Mexico (Banco de México). Starting January of 2008, Banco de México has adopted as an operating target the overnight interbank rate (tasa de fondeo bancario) instead of the level of commercial banks’ current account balances at the central bank (corto). This page provides - Mexico Interest Rate - actual values, historical data, forecast, chart, statistics, economic calendar and news.
author: Banco de México
